newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold rises on seasonal demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold rises on seasonal demand.

text.p: Gold 24 carat closed 30 rupees higher at 4,810 rupees per 10 gramme on seasonal buying
** Prices of gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) rose 400 rupees to 56,300 per piece, after staying steady this week following last week's rise of 1,100 rupees
** Silver (.999) ended 20 rupees lower at 7,020 rupees per kg on increasing arrivals of imported silver while industrial buyers kept to the sidelines
The approaching wedding season boosted demand for gold and the lower supplies added to the price surge, dealers said.
Fresh inflow was hit by the absence of sales by the customs department and negligible import.
Silver was undermined higher arrivals and sluggish industrial demand, dealers said.
Traders estimated arrivals in the local market at about 1,500-2,000 kg on Wednesday.
